alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 30 at 10:52AM EDT until September 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT this afternoon. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 ft on the north shore of Long Island, and 2 to 4 ft at Orient Point may result in beach erosion and flooding and possible localized dune erosion. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 30/12 PM 9.1/ 9.6 1.8/ 2.2 0.6/ 1.1 2 MINOR 01/01 AM 8.4/ 8.9 1.1/ 1.6 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE 01/01 PM 9.0/ 9.5 1.7/ 2.2 0.5/ 1.0 1 NONE 02/02 AM 8.0/ 8.5 0.7/ 1.1 0.5/ 1.0 1 NONE 02/02 PM 8.7/ 9.2 1.4/ 1.9 0.5/ 1.0 1 NONE PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES -
